Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Sarah Kim. It's nice to meet you.
Hello, Sarah! It's great to meet you too. How are you feeling today?
Honestly, I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed. The semester just started, and I'm already feeling the pressure.
That sounds tough. It's a big transition after summer break. Can you tell me more about what's been overwhelming you?
I have exams and assignments piling up already, and while reconnecting with friends, I sensed they're all busy with their own lives.
That's understandable. It can be hard when we feel left behind. It's common to feel nostalgic for the easy-going days of summer during busy times like this. How have you been managing these feelings?
I've been trying to stay positive and keep up, but I can't help feeling anxious about my performance.
It's okay to feel anxious, especially with so many changes happening. Sometimes it helps to talk about what specifically is causing that anxiety. Would you like to explore that?
Yeah, I guess I'm worried about falling behind. I really want to succeed in my Biology courses.
It's commendable that you care about your studies. Could setting smaller, manageable goals help you feel more in control?
That might help! I didn't think about it that way.
How about we set a couple of small goals for this week? Something that aligns with your studies but also gives you room to breathe?
Okay! Maybe I can set aside some time each day to review my notes.
That sounds like a great start! Remember to also make time for your hobbies, like photography or hiking. They can be great stress relievers.
Yes, I'd love to go hiking this weekend.
That sounds lovely! Taking breaks is important. We can check in next week to see how those goals went. Does that sound good?
Absolutely! Thank you, this was really helpful.
You're welcome, Sarah! I'm glad to be here for you. Take care and enjoy your hike!
Hi, I'm back. This week has been pretty hard.
Welcome back, Sarah! I'm sorry to hear that. What's been going on?
I attended a group study session and just felt overshadowed by everyone's performance, especially my brother Joon.
I can see how that would be difficult. It's tough to compare ourselves to others, especially family. How did that make you feel?
I felt discouraged and withdrawn. I wanted to participate, but I just froze.
That's a natural reaction. Feeling overshadowed can lead to self-doubt. Have you considered how Joon's success reflects on your own journey?
Not at all! I've been too busy feeling inadequate to think about it positively.
It can be helpful to remember that everyone has their unique challenges. How might you celebrate your own achievements, no matter how small?
I could start recognizing the effort I put into my studies, even if my grades aren't perfect.
That's an excellent mindset! Recognizing your efforts can boost your confidence. Want to set a goal to track your progress this week?
Sure! Maybe I can note down one thing I did well each day.
That sounds like a rewarding exercise! Let me know how it goes when we check in next time.
I will! Thanks for listening.
Anytime, Sarah! I'm here for you. Take care!
Hi there. I'm back, but I'm feeling even worse.
Hi Sarah! I'm glad you returned. What's been happening this week?
I've been so anxious that I couldn't sleep, and I ended up missing a couple of assignments. I feel awful.
I'm really sorry to hear that. Missing assignments can be stressful, especially when you're already feeling under pressure. How has that impacted your mood?
It's made me feel really isolated. I reached out to friends, but they were all busy.
It's tough to feel disconnected when you're already struggling. Have you thought about talking to a friend or family member about how you're feeling?
I think I need to, but I'm scared of being judged.
That's a common fear. What if you started with someone you trust, like your sister Minji? Sharing can sometimes lift a burden.
You're right. I hadn't considered that. I guess I can try.
That's a positive step! It's okay to be vulnerable. Just remember, it's part of being human. And you deserve support too.
I appreciate your understanding. I just feel so self-critical.
Self-criticism can be tough. Perhaps practicing self-compassion could help. What's one kind thing you could say to yourself right now?
Maybe I could say that I'm doing the best I can under the circumstances.
That's a great start, Sarah! You're facing challenges, and it's important to acknowledge your effort. Let's check in next week and see how it goes.
Thanks, I will do that.
Hi, I'm back again. I went to my first counseling session last week.
Hi Sarah! I'm glad you returned. How did it go?
It was both relieving and intimidating. I talked about my anxiety and feelings of inadequacy.
That's fantastic that you took that step! It often helps to share those feelings. Did they provide any coping strategies?
They did! But I still feel anxious about the changes I need to make.
That's understandable. Change can be daunting. Remember, it takes time. What's one small step you're thinking of taking?
I want to try setting specific times to study and then go hiking afterward as a reward.
That sounds like a wonderful idea! Setting a reward can motivate you to accomplish your study goals. Have you thought about sharing this plan with someone close to you for accountability?
I think I could tell Minji. She might help me stay on track.
That's a great approach! Sharing your goals can provide support. Would you like to practice how you might start that conversation?
Yes, that would help.
Let's role-play! You can begin by sharing your feeling and your intention for accountability with her.
Okay! I'd start with, 'Hey Minji, I've been feeling pretty overwhelmed and want to improve my study habits. Can you help keep me accountable?'
Perfect, that's open and honest. I'm proud of you for taking these steps. Remember, take things one step at a time. We can revisit this next session.
Thank you for all your help. It feels good to have a plan!
